attributes.action: Put an end to the rising level of miscarriages of justice cases in the UK!
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair and unlawful for the law to steal years away from someones life who hasn't even committed the crime, hence by enforcing more better judges and lawyers, review cases again, provide enough money, they would be a decrease in the amount of cases.
attributes.background: We want the government to make the justice system more thorough and fair to ensure that no wrongful imprisonments take place.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about miscarriages of justice, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Abolish Section 13 of the Criminal Appeal Act 1995: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/635680

Increase funding for the Criminal Cases Review Commission: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/627415
